definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He lacdfds. com on his back, his teeth set, his right hand clenched on his breast.
sentences.chinese: 他仰卧着，牙关紧闭，右手紧握着拳头胸口上。

sentences.english: The visitor hammered against the door with his fists.
sentences.chinese: 来访者用拳头使劲地锤打着大门。

sentences.english: His longest nail is 35cm (14ins) long and prevents him from making his hand into a fist.
sentences.chinese: 现在他最长的指甲已有35厘米，这使他无法攥拳头。

sentences.english: Second, place your fist in the upper waist.
sentences.chinese: 第二，把拳头放在前腰偏上方。

sentences.english: After each baby is born, he grasps his fists tightly.
sentences.chinese: 每个宝宝生下来，他们都会紧紧握住自己的小拳头。

sentences.english: His fists clenched as he faced the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 当他面对敌人时，他的两个拳头紧紧攥着。

sentences.english: When you can no longer make a fist.
sentences.chinese: 到了你再也不能握紧拳头的时候。

sentences.english: She made the mistake of smiling mockingly, saw his fist draw back.
sentences.chinese: 看到他的拳头撤回去，她犯了个错误，嘲讽地微笑着。

sentences.english: Too bad your fists aren't as fast as your mouth.
sentences.chinese: 只可惜您那铁拳头及不上你的嘴皮子快啊。

sentences.english: Do you want to fight? Then hold your fist tight!
sentences.chinese: 你想打架吗？那就捏紧拳头吧。

sentences.english: The light box can give you a fist look at the shop.
sentences.chinese: 这些灯箱可以给你的店一拳头看看。

sentences.english: The competitive products of our company are quality air conditioners.
sentences.chinese: 我们公司的拳头产品是高品质的空调。

sentences.english: Another Taekkyon practicer had his fist pierce through the clay-wall.
sentences.chinese: 另一个跆跟练习者用拳头打入泥墙中。

sentences.english: This product is also my fist Products unit.
sentences.chinese: 此产品也是我单位的拳头产品。

sentences.english: The man saw us and stopped his assault. They both waved me on.
sentences.chinese: 那个男人停止了攻击看这我们，并朝我们挥动着拳头。

sentences.english: Typical report has long been the most competitive product in TV propagandistic news.
sentences.chinese: 典型报道一直以来都是电视新闻宣传的拳头产品。

definition: to pinch (with one's fingers)/to knead/to make up
to beat with the fist/to hammer/to cudgel
hammer/to hammer into shape/weight (e.g. of a steelyard or balance)/to strike with a hammer
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
the five fingers of one's hand
to hold firmly, not let go
